title: `#[used(compiler)]` and `#[used(linker)]` should work on functions.

labels.name: T-lang
labels.description: Relevant to the language team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Related to #93798
cc @cynecx since you did the implementation.
cc @Meziu and @ian-h-chamberlain

The `#[used(compiler)]` and `#[used(linker)]` should work on functions. They weren't explicitly one of the main motivating use cases brought up in #47384, but expanding them to support functions would be very beneficial. For example, in https://github.com/Meziu/pthread-3ds and https://github.com/Meziu/rust-linker-fix-3ds we have to have an empty ["init" function](https://github.com/Meziu/pthread-3ds/blob/90bd4d00e371ea5dbd8487c5a63d3d75d667f796/src/lib.rs#L8-L12) just so the exported functions don't get thrown out.

I was expecting these annotations to fix our problem, so I was excited to try them out when I heard they hit nightly. However, the following fails to compile:
```rust
#![feature(used_with_arg)]

#[used(compiler)]
#[no_mangle]
pub unsafe extern "C" fn foo() {}
```
[playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=517bb4501f5291162bcaae9edc89156e)

```
error: attribute must be applied to a `static` variable
 --> src/lib.rs:3:1
  |
3 | #[used(compiler)]
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

Interestingly, changing to `#[used(linker)]` results in an extra message (Edit: fixed by #94377):
```
error: `used(compiler)` and `used(linker)` can't be used together
 --> src/lib.rs:3:1
  |
3 | #[used(linker)]
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
4 | #[no_mangle]
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

Does `no_mangle` imply `used(compiler)`?
